discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Hyperband: Efficient & best --> Right answer
B. Grid Search: Exhaustive and tries all combos
C. Bayesian Optimization: Smart with best combination
D. Random Search: Random

Selected Answer: A
https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/machine-learning/amazon-sagemaker-automatic-model-tuning-now-provides-up-to-three-times-faster-hyperparameter-tuning-with-hyperband/
"efficient resource utilization and a better time-to-convergence."

questions.question_text:
A company is building a deep learning model on Amazon SageMaker. The company uses a large amount of data as the training dataset. The company needs to optimize the model's hyperparameters to minimize the loss function on the validation dataset.
Which hyperparameter tuning strategy will accomplish this goal with the LEAST computation time?

choices.B: Provision a Redshift cluster and Amazon SageMaker Studio in a VPC with no public access enabled in the primary account. Create an AWS Direct Connect connection and a transit gateway. Associate the VPCs from both accounts with the transit gateway. Update the VPC route tables to remove the route to 0.0.0.0/0.
choices.A: Provision a Redshift cluster and Amazon SageMaker Studio in a VPC with no public access enabled in the primary account. Create a VPC peering connection between the accounts. Update the VPC route tables to remove the route to 0.0.0.0/0.
choices.D: Provision a Redshift cluster and Amazon SageMaker Studio in a VPC in the primary account. Create an S3 gateway endpoint. Update the S3 bucket policy to allow IAM principals from the primary account. Set up interface VPC endpoints for SageMaker and Amazon Redshift.
choices.C: Provision a Redshift cluster and Amazon SageMaker Studio in a VPC in the primary account. Create an AWS Site-to-Site VPN connection with two encrypted IPsec tunnels between the accounts. Set up interface VPC endpoints for Amazon S3.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
VPC endpoints for sagemaker and gateway endpoint for S3 is needed to access without public access to connect to VPC

Selected Answer: D
This is privatelink use-case

questions.question_text:
A company is planning to use Amazon Redshift ML in its primary AWS account. The source data is in an Amazon S3 bucket in a secondary account.
An ML engineer needs to set up an ML pipeline in the primary account to access the S3 bucket in the secondary account. The solution must not require public IPv4 addresses.
Which solution will meet these requirements?

A company is using an AWS Lambda function to monitor the metrics from an ML model. An ML engineer needs to implement a solution to send an email message when the metrics breach a threshold.
Which solution will meet this requirement?

choices.A: Log the metrics from the Lambda function to AWS CloudTrail. Configure a CloudTrail trail to send the email message.
choices.D: Log the metrics from the Lambda function to Amazon CloudWatch. Configure an Amazon CloudFront rule to send the email message.
choices.B: Log the metrics from the Lambda function to Amazon CloudFront. Configure an Amazon CloudWatch alarm to send the email message.
choices.C: Log the metrics from the Lambda function to Amazon CloudWatch. Configure a CloudWatch alarm to send the email message.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
CloudWatch alarm is the keyword; Needed to alert

Selected Answer: C
Simple event-driven architecture

choices.A: Adjust the model's parameters and hyperparameters.
choices.B: Initiate a manual Model Monitor job that uses the most recent production data.
choices.D: Include additional data in the existing training set for the model. Retrain and redeploy the model.
choices.C: Create a new baseline from the latest dataset. Update Model Monitor to use the new baseline for evaluations.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Amazon SageMaker Model Monitor:

 Continuously monitors model endpoints to detect issues like:
 Data quality drift
 Model quality drift
 Bias drift
 Feature attribution drift

Baseline:

 Model Monitor compares incoming data against a baseline dataset that represents "normal" or expected data distributions.
 If the data distribution changes after a model update, the old baseline may no longer be validâ€”leading to false positives in data quality issues.

Selected Answer: C
agree with GiorgioGss - If the problems start appearing "After a model update" then C is the only valid option.

Selected Answer: D
the model needs to be retrained

Selected Answer: C
Model Monitor gives data quality issues --> Create new baseline --> Validate baseline --> Update Model Monitor with new baseline --> Reevaluate data quality --> Investigate and fix root cause (if issues persist) --> Monitor continuously

Selected Answer: C
If the problems start appearing "After a model update" then C is the only valid option.

questions.question_text:
A company has used Amazon SageMaker to deploy a predictive ML model in production. The company is using SageMaker Model Monitor on the model. After a model update, an ML engineer notices data quality issues in the Model Monitor checks.
What should the ML engineer do to mitigate the data quality issues that Model Monitor has identified?

choices.A: Create an Amazon SageMaker batch transform job to process all the images in the S3 bucket.
choices.B: Create an Amazon SageMaker Asynchronous Inference endpoint and a scaling policy. Run a script to make an inference request for each image.
choices.C: Create an Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS) cluster that uses Karpenter for auto scaling. Host the model on the EKS cluster. Run a script to make an inference request for each image.
choices.D: Create an AWS Batch job that uses an Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS) cluster. Specify a list of images to process for each AWS Batch job.

questions.question_text:
A company has an ML model that generates text descriptions based on images that customers upload to the company's website. The images can be up to 50 MB in total size.
An ML engineer decides to store the images in an Amazon S3 bucket. The ML engineer must implement a processing solution that can scale to accommodate changes in demand.
Which solution will meet these requirements with the LEAST operational overhead?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sagemaker/latest/dg/async-inference-autoscale.html To autoscale asynchronous endpoint -> Register model -> Define and apply scaling policy; Other options are complex to implement

Selected Answer: B
LEAST effort = B
